sanskrit_verse:
प्रच्छन्नं वा प्रकाशं वा तन्निषेवेत यो नरः ।
तस्य दण्डविकल्पः स्याद्यथेष्टं नृपतेस्तथा ॥ ९.२२८॥
transliteration:
pracchannaṃ vā prakāśaṃ vā tanniṣeveta yo naraḥ |
tasya daṇḍavikalpaḥ syādyatheṣṭaṃ nṛpatestathā || 9.228||
sph_interpretive_translation: Whosoever engages in acts—whether concealed or open—that violate Dharma, shall face a choice of corrective measures determined by the sovereign authority, aligned with restoring balance and consciousness integrity.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: Sovereign discretion is rooted in Dharma, not arbitrary power.
Causation: Violation of Dharma generates imbalance requiring conscious correction.
Capacity-based responsibility: The violator retains the capacity to choose alignment through corrective engagement.
Restoration logic: Justice is executed to restore harmony, not inflict suffering.
Consciousness alignment: Corrective measures aim at elevating awareness, not suppressing action.
executable_legal_axioms: IF an act violates Dharma THEN present corrective options to the violator based on capacity for realignment.
IF concealment is involved THEN restoration includes transparency integration.
IF openness is involved THEN restoration focuses on alignment reinforcement.
THE sovereign selects from pre-defined restorative protocols based on Dharma-adherent criteria.
ALL corrective actions MUST exclude punitive intent and include consciousness elevation mechanisms.
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, this axiom empowers judicial authorities to apply Dharma-rooted corrective frameworks that bypass punitive sentencing. The court functions as a consciousness-integrity mechanism, ensuring violators engage in completion processes rather than endure retributive consequences.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that violation disrupts cosmic and social equilibrium. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that unaddressed violations propagate further disorder. Proportional responsibility lies in offering choice-based correction. Non-punitive reality is upheld as justice serves restoration, not vengeance.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Offer violator a choice among pre-approved restorative engagements.
Assign completion process aligned with violated Dharma principle.
Integrate transparency practices where concealment was present.
Facilitate guided meditation or consciousness alignment sessions.
Reconnect violator with community through service-based reintegration.
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through conscious choice and alignment. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
